column1: Mit Mietvertrag vom 30. März bzw. 4. April 2017 mietete B.________ (Mieterin
column2: Beschwerdegegnerin) von der A.________ AG (Vermieterin
column3: Beschwerdeführerin) per 16. April 2017 eine 2-Zimmerwohnung (4. OG) an der U.________strasse in Zürich. Vereinbart wurde ein monatlicher Nettomietzins von Fr. 1'060.-- zuzüglich einer Akontozahlung von Fr. 55.-- für Heiz- und Warmwasserkosten sowie von Fr. 110.-- für Betriebskosten. Mit Formular vom 30. März 2017 teilte die Vermieterin der Mieterin den von der Vormieterin zuletzt geschuldeten sowie den neuen Mietzins mit. Der frühere Nettomietzins belief sich auf monatlich Fr. 738.-- (bei gleichen Akontozahlungen für Nebenkosten). Zur Begründung der Mietzinserhöhung führte die Vermieterin eine ""Anpassung an die orts- und quartierüblichen Verhältnisse"" an.

the court rules that the plaintiff's appeal is unfounded and orders it to pay the costs of the federal court proceedings. The judgment also notes that no party compensation is due under the court's rules.

the court upholds the decision of the cantonal court (Kantonsgericht) that the transfer of ownership of real estate from one fund management company to another triggers a taxable event under the cantonal tax law."

column1: Beschwerde gegen das Urteil des Sozialversicherungsgerichts des Kantons Zürich

Der 1988 in Deutschland geborene A.________ leidet seit einem Skiunfall vom 15. Januar 2005 an einer inkompletten Paraplegie sub Th 8(unterhalb des achten Brustwirbels). Nach seiner Einreise in die Schweiz am 11. Juli 2016 meldete er sich am 11. August 2017 bei der Invalidenversicherung zum Leistungsbezug an
column2: wobei er einen Rollstuhl sowie Amortisationsbeiträge für sein Motorfahrzeug beantragte. Nach verschiedenen Abklärungen gewährte ihm die IV-Stelle des Kantons Zürich (fortan: IV-Stelle oder Beschwerdegegnerin) am 8. Januar 2018 die anbegehrten Amortisationsbeiträge und erteilte überdies Kostengutsprache für verschiedene Anpassungen am Fahrzeug. Am 18. September 2018 sprach sie A.________ zudem einen Kostenbeitrag für einen neuen Rollstuhl zu. Infolge verschiedener weiterer Anmeldungen in den Jahren 2017 bis 2021 erhielt er zusätzliche Hilfsmittel. Mit Formular vom 7. Oktober 2021 (Eingang bei der IV-Stelle: 11. Oktober 2021) meldete er sich schliesslich zum Bezug einer Hilflosenentschädigung an. Die IV-Stelle liess vor Ort eine Abklärung für Hilflosenentschädigung durchführen (Bericht vom 9. Dezember 2021) und sprach ihm mit Verfügung vom 1. April 2022 ab 1. Oktober 2020 eine Hilflosenentschädigung aufgrund leichter Hilflosigkeit zu.

";"The text is a summary of a decision by the Swiss Federal Tribunal (Bundesgericht). The case involves a dispute between an insured person (Beschwerdeführer) and an insurance company regarding the payment of invalidity benefits. The insured person had received benefits from 2016 to 2021
column2: but then claimed that they were no longer entitled to these benefits.

column1: The Federal Tribunal upheld the decision of the cantonal court to some extent. It found that the insurance company was entitled to recover the benefits paid out between May 2016 and November 2020
column2: as this period had passed the three-year statute of limitations. However
column3: it rejected the insurance company's claim to recover the benefits paid out between January 2020 and November 2020
column4: as the insured person had timely objected to the recovery on November 23

column1: The Federal Tribunal also ruled that the interest rate for late payments should be set at 2% per annum
column2: based on the regulations of the pension fund. It further ordered that the parties should bear their own costs and that the insured person was entitled to a reduced compensation payment.
the case was remanded to the cantonal court to recalculate the compensation payment."

";"The text is a decision by the Swiss Federal Supreme Court (Bundesgericht) on a case involving the Swiss pension system (AHV). The court's ruling concerns the calculation of an adjustment to pensions that are temporarily suspended (Rentenzuschlag).
1. The Bundesrat (Federal Council) had introduced a new method for calculating the Rentenzuschlag
column2: which was based on the average value of the suspended pension benefits rather than the pension benefit that would have been payable at the time of suspension.

column1: 2. The court found that this new method was in line with the constitutional and statutory requirements
column2: which aim to ensure that pensions are adjusted to reflect changes in living costs and income.

column1: 3. The court rejected the plaintiff's argument that the new method was inconsistent with the constitution and statutes
column2: as it would lead to a disproportionate increase in the value of the Rentenzuschlag over time.

column1: 4. The court concluded that the Bundesrat had not exceeded its statutory powers in introducing the new method.

column2: the court dismissed the appeal and ordered the plaintiff to pay the costs of CHF 500.

";"The text is a decision by the Swiss Federal Supreme Court (Bundesgericht) in a case involving an international arbitration agreement under the 1985 Investment Agreement (ISA). The court rejected a challenge to its previous decision
column2: which held that the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID) had jurisdiction over a dispute between an investor and the People's Republic of China.

column1: The court's decision was based on Article 13(3) of the ISA
column2: which provides that the ICSID shall have exclusive jurisdiction to decide disputes arising out of or related to an investment. The court also noted that the ISA allows for the possibility of parallel proceedings before both national courts and international arbitral tribunals.

column1: The court rejected the investor's argument that the Chinese state courts were not capable of determining whether a taking had occurred or was lawful
column2: as Article 6(2) of the ISA provides that the investor may submit to the state courts' review the question of whether a taking has occurred or is lawful. The court also held that the ICSID's jurisdiction was not dependent on the investor's ability to pursue claims before national courts.

column1: The court further rejected the investor's argument that the ICSID had failed to provide a fair and impartial hearing
column2: as it had provided an opportunity for the parties to present their cases and evidence. The court also noted that the ICSID's decision was based on the applicable law and the facts of the case
column3: rather than the investor's personal circumstances.

column2: the court awarded costs and expenses to the respondent (the People's Republic of China) in the amount of CHF 250
column4: which is to be borne by the applicant investors. The court also ordered that the applicants bear the costs of the Federal Supreme Court proceedings
column5: including Fr. 200
column6: 000 for legal fees."

column1: Au nom de la IIe Cour de droit pénal
";"The text is a judicial decision from the Swiss Federal Tribunal
column2: dated October 30
column3: 2023. The case involves a recourant who was convicted of complicity in an offense committed by his father. The recourant argues that the conviction was unlawful because it was based on an unequal quid pro quo (a favor or advantage) and that the court of appeal did not properly evaluate the evidence.

column1: The Federal Tribunal rejects the recourant's arguments
column2: finding that the court of appeal did not violate federal law in concluding that the recourant had committed an act entering into his official activity as a public agent. The tribunal also finds that the recourant's actions constituted complicity in the offense committed by his father
column3: and that he was aware of and accepted his role in facilitating the crime.

column1: The decision confirms the conviction and orders the recourant to pay court fees and an indemnity."

The Swiss Federal Tribunal ruled on a constitutional complaint and an appeal in a case involving a hotel-restaurant project. Les démarches de la recourante peuvent tout aussi bien s'expliquer par des considérations purement économiques; il ressort du reste des faits constatés que c'est bien pour des raisons économiques qu'elle a finalement décidé de renoncer à la construction d'une nouvelle galerie qu'elle avait envisagée dès 2008. ";"The text is a judgment by the Swiss Federal Tribunal (Tribunal Fédéral) in a case involving a concession agreement between a company and the Canton of Valais. The company
column2: which had been granted a concession to harness hydroelectric power from the Navizence river
column3: was required to pay an impôt spécial (special tax) on its water usage.

column1: The company appealed the decision by the Cantonal Court of Public Law (Cour de droit public)
column2: arguing that the impôt spécial should not be calculated based on the total water flow
column3: but only on the actual amount of water used for electricity generation.

column1: The Federal Tribunal upheld the appeal and annulled the previous decision. It held that the construction of a new canal to divert excess water from the Navizence river did not constitute an installation within the meaning of Article 51
column2: paragraph 3
column3: of the Swiss Federal Law (LFH). Therefore
column4: the impôt spécial should be calculated based only on the actual amount of water used for electricity generation
column5: and not on the total water flow.

column1: The Tribunal also ordered the Canton of Valais to pay the company's legal costs and awarded it an indemnity. The case was remitted to the Cantonal Court for a new decision regarding the calculation of the impôt spécial."

Encore faut-il que la correction du vice soit susceptible d'influer sur le sort de la cause (art. 97 al. 1 LTF).

1. The appeal against the direct federal tax is rejected.
2. The appeal against the cantonal taxes of the Canton of Zurich is also rejected.
3. The appellants are ordered to pay the costs of the federal proceedings

column1: The court's reasoning is as follows:
* The appellants' rent from the Swiss Federal Social Insurance Association (BÄV) is subject to taxation as ordinary income.
* The court rejects the argument that Article 204 of the Direct Tax Act (DBG) should be applied to the appellants' rent
column2: as this provision only applies to retirement benefits paid out before January 1
column3: 1987 or after December 31

column1: * The canton of Zurich's tax ordinance (StG/ZH) classifies all income from old-age

column3: as well as from vocational provident funds
column4: as taxable income
column5: with a 40% tax rate applying to life annuities and income from surrendering assets.

column2: 1987 or after December 31

";"The text is a judgment by the Swiss Federal Tribunal (Bundesgericht) in a case involving a dispute over procedural costs. The main points of the judgment are:
1. The appellant had partially succeeded in his appeal
column2: but the tribunal had reduced the extent of his success to half due to his failure to succeed with some of his claims.

column1: 2. The tribunal's decision was based on Article 106 Abs. 2 ZPO
column2: which allows for a reduction in procedural costs when an appeal is only partially successful.

column1: 3. The appellant had argued that the tribunal had erred in its calculation of the extent of his success
column2: but the court found no error and therefore dismissed the appeal.

column1: 4. The tribunal also dismissed the appellant's claim for a correction to the decision due to an inconsistency between the grounds and decision.

column2: the appellant was ordered to pay the costs of Fr. 10'000.- to the other party.

column3: and was signed by the President of the II. zivilrechtlichen Abteilung (Civil Division) of the Swiss Federal Tribunal."

";"The text is a decision by the Swiss Federal Supreme Court (Bundesgericht) regarding a case about social assistance (Sozialhilfe). The court rules in favor of the plaintiff
column2: who had received social assistance benefits from April 2019 to March 2022. The court finds that the Social Assistance Act (SHG) and the old-age pension law (AHV-Rente) were not violated by granting the social assistance benefits.

column1: The key points of the decision are:
1. The Vorsorgeschutz (anticipatory protection) was lifted when the plaintiff decided to take early retirement
column2: as this allowed them to access their freedom benefit to finance their living expenses from that point on.

column1: 2. The court finds that the Social Assistance Act and the old-age pension law were not violated by granting the social assistance benefits
column2: as the plaintiff's financial situation would have been precarious without these benefits.

column1: 3. The court rules that the plaintiff had the right to receive social assistance benefits until they reached the age of 63
column2: which is the maximum age for receiving AHV-Rente (old-age pension).

column1: 4. The court rejects the argument that the plaintiff should have used their freedom benefit earlier and instead finds that the Vorsorgeschutz was more important in this case.

column2: the court upholds the social assistance benefits received by the plaintiff from April 2019 to March 2022.

column1: The decision also deals with the question of whether the plaintiff's freedom benefit could be seized (Rückerstattung) and notes that the principle of limited seizure (Grundsatz der beschränkten Pfändbarkeit) would apply. However
column2: this issue is not further explored in the decision."

column1: Au nom de la IIe Cour de droit public
";"The text is a court decision by the Swiss Federal Tribunal (Tribunal fédéral) regarding a dispute between the Republic and Canton of Neuchâtel and the Swiss Migration Authority (SEM).

column2: the SEM suspended the payment of certain indemnities to the Canton of Neuchâtel due to changes in asylum laws. The Canton of Neuchâtel claimed that this suspension was illegal because it did not receive a formal decision from the SEM.

column1: The court held that the SEM's decision to suspend the payments was lawful and did not require a formal decision prior to its implementation. The court noted that the Canton of Neuchâtel had no formal right to receive these indemnities in the first place
column2: and that the SEM's suspension of payments was merely a consequence of changes in the law.
the court rejected the Canton of Neuchâtel's appeal (recours) and ordered it to pay the costs of the case (fr. 3'000). The court also declined to award any damages to the SEM."
Präsident
Bovey

Dabei handelt es sich um eine vermögensrechtliche Zivilsache nach Art. 72 Abs. 1 BGG (Urteile 5A_347/2019 vom 9. April 2020 E. 1.1; 5A_339/2018 vom 8. Mai 2019 E. 1). Die nämliche Qualifikation gilt für den nicht selbständig eröffneten Entscheid über die unentgeltliche Rechtspflege im Berufungsverfahren (Urteil 5A_750/2020

column1: La liberté de conscience et de croyance protège toute personne contre les ingérences de l'Etat qui seraient de nature à gêner ses convictions religieuses. Elle confère à toute personne le droit d'exiger que l'Etat n'intervienne pas de façon injustifiée en édictant des règles limitant l'expression et la pratique de ses convictions religieuses (ATF 148 I 160 consid. 7.2; 142 I 195 consid. 5.1; 118 Ia 46 consid. 3b). column1: Im Namen der IV. öffentlich-rechtlichen Abteilung
";"The text is a court decision from the Swiss Federal Supreme Court
column2: specifically the IV. public law division
column3: regarding an appeal against a judgment of the St. Gallen Cantonal Court. The case involves a widow who was entitled to monthly compensation payments (Ergänzungsleistungen) due to her husband's early death and his contributions to the old-age and survivors' insurance (Vorsorge- und Hinterlassenenversicherung). The issue at hand is whether the widow's income from caring for her husband should be taken into account when calculating her entitlement to these compensation payments.

column1: The court held that the widow's income from caring for her husband should not be considered when calculating her entitlement to the compensation payments. This decision was based on the fact that the compensation payments are intended to compensate for the loss of a breadwinner
column2: and the widow's income from caring for her husband is not directly related to this loss.

column1: The court also noted that the widow would have been entitled to compensation for her husband's care and nursing costs if these costs exceeded any surplus in their joint income. However
column2: the court found that the lower cantonal court had incorrectly applied the relevant law (Art. 12 Abs. 1 VKB/SG) by requiring the widow to consider her husband's care and nursing costs when calculating her entitlement to compensation.

the Supreme Court annulled the judgment of the St. Gallen Cantonal Court and sent the case back to the lower court for re-decision. The court also ordered the appellants (the widow and her husband) to pay the court fees (Fr. 500.-)."
Presidente
Muschietti

";"The text is a judgment of the Swiss Federal Supreme Court (Bundesgericht) in a case regarding an invalidity pension. The court rules that the applicant's claim for an early retirement pension due to disability is not admissible
column2: as she has not demonstrated any objective grounds justifying the expansion of the provision on provisional insurance (provisorische Weiterversicherung) to cases like hers.

column1: The court notes that the legislative intention behind this provision was to address specific obstacles in reintegration attempts for retirees
column2: which are different from those faced by individuals who have not yet retired. The applicant's situation is characterized by a lower barrier to reintegration and no equivalent need for protection as retirees do.

column1: The court also rejects the argument that the retroactive award of a reduced or time-limited invalidity pension would be subject to the same rules as revising an existing pension claim under Article 17 ATSG. The court finds that there is no constitutional requirement to apply the provision in this case
column2: and therefore upholds the decision of the lower court.

";"The Swiss Federal Court has ruled in favor of a biogas producer who was seeking a higher feed-in tariff (FIT) for the electricity produced by their facility. The court found that the lower FIT rate applied to non-allowed biomass did not apply
column2: as the facility was considered a hybrid plant.

column1: The court held that Article 16(2) of the Swiss Federal Act on Energy Supply (EnFV) requires the calculation of equivalent power outputs for hybrid plants using the entire production. This means that the court will recalculate the FIT rate based on the total electricity produced
column2: rather than just the amount from renewable energy sources.

column1: The court also rejected the argument that the biogas producer should be required to install separate measurement devices to track the different energy streams. Instead
column2: the court held that the entire production is relevant for calculating the equivalent power outputs.

column1: As a result of the ruling
column2: the case will be sent back to the Pronovo AG (the entity responsible for implementing the EnFV) for recalculation of the FIT rate. The biogas producer will also be required to pay the court costs."

Le recourant a pris part à la procédure devant l'autorité précédente (art. 89 al. 1 let. a LTF) et est particulièrement touché par l'arrêt attaqué qui confirme l'irrecevabilité du recours dirigé contre la transmission de renseignements le concernant au juge civil. Il dispose ainsi d'un intérêt digne de protection à l'annulation ou à la modification de cette décision (art. 89 al. 1 let. b et c LTF). Du point de vue de la juridiction civile

column2: according to Article 156 of the Civil Procedure Code (CPC)

column4: taking into account the specific circumstances of each case.

Le principe est violé lorsque quelqu'un est poursuivi pénalement en raison d'un comportement qui n'est pas visé par la loi; lorsque l'application du droit pénal à un acte déterminé procède d'une interprétation de la norme pénale excédant ce qui est admissible au regard des principes généraux du droit pénal; ou si quelqu'un est poursuivi en application d'une norme pénale qui n'a pas de fondement juridique. Le principe s'applique à l'ensemble du droit pénal. Il n'exclut pas une interprétation extensive de la loi à la charge du prévenu (ATF 148 IV 234 consid. 3.5; 147 II 274 consid. 2.1.1; 145 IV 470 consid. 4.5 et les références citées; 138 IV 13 consid. 4.1).

";"The text is a summary of a court decision by the Federal Tribunal of Switzerland. The case involves a request to assist in suicide
column2: and the court's ruling on whether this act should be punishable under Swiss law.
the court concludes that the current legal framework does not provide a clear basis for punishing assistance in suicide
column3: and therefore
column4: it is not possible to convict someone for providing such assistance without a specific change in the law. The court notes that while some organizations of medical professionals have developed ethical guidelines on this issue
column5: there is no consensus on the matter.

column1: The court further states that any changes to the legal framework would require a broader consideration of the ethical and moral implications of assisted suicide
column2: rather than relying on an overly broad interpretation of existing laws. Finally
column3: the court rules that the case should be rejected
column4: without awarding any fees or costs to either party."

Die Beschwerden der Versicherten und der Suva werden teilweise gutgeheissen und der Entscheid des Verwaltungsgerichts des Kantons Thurgau vom 17. Mai 2023 wird aufgehoben. Die Sache wird zu neuer Entscheidung an die Vorinstanz zurückgewiesen. Im Übrigen werden die Beschwerden abgewiesen.
